query: What are the specific carpet area requirements for classrooms in a Maritime Training Institute based on student intake capacity?
expected_answer: According to the Training Manual, the carpet area requirement depends on the number of candidates: 20 candidates requires 30 m²; 24 candidates requires 36 m²; and 40 candidates requires 50 m². Institutes approved prior to November 1, 2016 may continue with prevalent sizes unless capacity increases.

query: Summarize the mandatory minimum rest hour requirements for watch-keeping personnel under the STCW Convention, including how these periods can be divided and any permissible exceptions.
expected_answer: The STCW Convention mandates: 1) A minimum of 10 hours of rest in any 24-hour period. 2) A total of at least 77 hours of rest in any 7-day period. 3) The daily 10 hours may be divided into no more than two periods, one of which must be at least 6 hours long. 4) Exceptions allow a reduction to 70 hours in a 7-day period for up to two weeks, with intervals between exceptions at least twice the duration of the exception.

query: What is the classification of shipboard tasks according to the STCW guide?
expected_answer: Shipboard tasks are classified by functions and levels of responsibility. There are seven functional areas and three levels of responsibility: management level (senior officers), operational level (junior officers), and support level (ratings).

query: What are the two types of GMDSS certificates mentioned in the STCW guide?
expected_answer: The two types of GMDSS certificates are: 1. The General Operator's Certificate (GOC) for personnel on deep-sea ships operating beyond VHF coast station coverage. 2. The Restricted Operator's Certificate (ROC) for personnel on ships operating only in sea areas within VHF coverage (coastal areas).

query: What are the five criteria for standards of physical and medical fitness for seafarers?
expected_answer: The five criteria are: 1) Physical capability to fulfill basic training requirements. 2) Adequate hearing and speech to communicate and detect alarms. 3) No medical condition preventing safe conduct of duties. 4) No medical condition likely to be aggravated by sea service or endanger others. 5) Not taking medication with side effects that impair judgment or balance.

query: What are the general requirements to obtain a certificate of competency as a Chief Mate on ships of 3,000 gross tonnage or more?
expected_answer: To be a Chief Mate on ships of 3,000 GT or more, one must: a) Meet requirements for officer in charge of a navigational watch on ships of 500 GT or more and have at least 12 months approved seagoing service in that capacity. b) Complete approved education and training and meet the standard of competence specified in section A-II/2 of the STCW Code.

query: What is the minimum floor area per candidate required for hostel rooms in a Maritime Training Institute?
expected_answer: The floor area for hostel rooms should be a minimum of 4 m² per candidate.

query: What is the minimum size requirement for the Principal/Head of Institute's room?
expected_answer: A separate room of not less than 8 m² shall be provided for the Principal or Head of the Institute.
